alert.note: Alert for Bell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 5:46PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Harlan and Bell Counties through 615 PM EST... At 546 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Kettle Island to near Pruden. Movement was east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Pineville, Callaway, Blackmont, Balkan, Miracle, Kettle Island, Stony Fork Junction, Varilla, Oaks and Arjay around 550 PM EST. Molus, Coldiron, Black Snake, Pathfork and Tacky Town around 555 PM EST. Wallins Creek, Kentenia, Tremont, Binghamtown, Hensley Store and Meldrum around 600 PM EST. Harlan, Loyall, Elcomb, Teetersville, Tway, Sunshine, Grays Knob, White Star, Mary Alice and Harlan Gas around 605 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Chevrolet, Lenarve, Ages, Coxton, Kitts, Golden Ash, Bobs Creek, Rosspoint, Three Point, Martins Fork Lake, Evarts, Kenvir, Kildav, Black Mountain, Darkmont, Verda, Bailey Creek, Short Town, Colts and Dizney. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EST for south central and southeastern Kentucky.
